alert.note: Alert for Alamosa Vicinity, Central San Luis Valley Below 8500 Ft; Southern San Luis Valley; Upper Rio Grande Valley, Eastern San Juan Mountains Below 10000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 1:41PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Alamosa, southeastern Rio Grande and north central Conejos Counties through 215 PM MDT... At 140 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Capulin, or 17 miles southwest of Alamosa, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, half inch hail and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Alamosa, southeastern Rio Grande and north central Conejos Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Alamosa Vicinity, Central San Luis Valley Below 8500 Ft; Southern San Luis Valley; Upper Rio Grande Valley, Eastern San Juan Mountains Below 10000 Ft
